summary: Last night I dreamt I was at a 1D concert and 2015!Harry was just sitting on stage calmly explaining his hair routine
body:
Last night I dreamt I was at a 1D concert and 2015!Harry was just sitting on stage calmly explaining his hair routine

I can’t quite recall, but there was lemon juice involved for some reason. Also there was school desks separating the crowd from the stage instead of security people???

tags: this is already up on ao3 but im posting this for those who like to read on tumblr better!
a new chapter will be posted after these :)
summary: “Well, you have just proven my point. Would you have willingly gone on this date if you knew? Just a little lie to get you there...
body:
finding finley; chapter one

“Well, you have just proven my point. Would you have willingly gone on this date if you knew? Just a little lie to get you there Finny, no harm done.”

I rolled my eyes and pulled my phone away from my ear to stop myself from cursing up a storm. “Point proven or not,” I shoved my phone back to my ear, “there’s no reason why my mother of all people should be setting me up on dates! I’m perfectly capable of doing that myself, thank you very much.”

She laughed once. “Oh Finley, when was the last time you seriously dated someone? You’re almost 24, I’m just trying to jump start something!”

“I didn’t know being 23 and single was a crime now.”

read chapter 1 the first impressions now 

ao3 / fic page

summary:
Louis when drunk: Harrahh I need to tell you a secret
Harry: *looking at his drunk boyfriend stumbling towards him* Anything...
body:
Louis when drunk: Harrahh I need to tell you a secret

Harry: *looking at his drunk boyfriend stumbling towards him* Anything Loubear

Louis: *falling onto Harry* I’m gay!!!

Harry: …

Louis: …

Harry: *laughing* I mean I sure hope so, we’ve been married for five years babe

Harry: Love you *blows a kiss*

NIALL ANON BLOG

title: BRUISES part 3
body:
ABOUT THE STORY

Part 3

HARRY

The more we talk, the more i remember why we were so close, and the more i realize she was missing in my life. She’s more confident than in my memories, and less shy. The way she grew up makes me smile and i find myself impatient to hear her next words, no matter what she’s talking about.

“There’s a party tonight, a frat party I should say.” I finally point out, taking a sip of my now cold coffee.

I let out a grimace and look up in her eyes.

“A frat party? Are you in a fraternity?”

Her question makes me chuckle and I shake my head slightly, leaning against the bench.

“Me? Come on, you know me better than that. Do you see me in a fraternity?”

I raise my eyebrows at her, the left corner of my lips still curled. She stares at me a few seconds and finally chuckles, shaking her head.

“No, I guess not.” she lets out. “You’re smarter than that.”

I smile more and lick my lips, crossing my arms over my chest.

“I’m just going because a few of my friends are going, and it’d be nice if you’d come with me.”

She tilts her head, staring at me, and i watch her as she starts nibbling nervously on her bottom lip. I glance at her mouth for half a second before looking back up in her eyes.

“Alright, but only if you promise not to leave me by myself in a house full of strangers.”

I didn’t expect that answer and I don’t know why, but her words make me smile even more.

“I’d never do that.” I admit in a low tone, moving against the table to be closer to her. “I promise I’ll follow you everywhere.”

She lets out a short laugh and leans against the table too. I see her from up close and my smile falters a bit at the connection we suddenly seem to have.

“I trust you.”

Her words seem sincere and her voice is low, and I end up promising myself that i’d never betray the trust that I don’t feel I deserve just yet. I know she’s giving it to me for old time’s sake and because we used to be very close, but we both changed and I’m scared to disappoint her. I would hate it.

“Thank you.”

We stare at each other for a while and after a few minutes, I move back, breathing in and sighing low.

“Do you want me to drop you back to your car?” I propose, trying to focus on my hands and avoiding her eyes for a reason I don’t understand. “I mean I thought about relaxing a bit before the party so I thought it wouldn’t be too interesting for you.”

OLIVIA

I felt an instant connection with him as soon as I saw him again but at this exact moment, while he’s sitting in front of me, staring at me, and making me a promise, I feel even closer to him. It’s hard to explain, it’s something that can’t be put into words. It’s something that you can only feel.

He thanks me for trusting him and I feel my heart skip a beat at the conversation we’re having. It seems so simple yet for some reason I feel like it’s deeper than it sounds.

He moves away and I realize I had been holding my breath. I inhaled deeply again but subtly and finally clear my throat, leaning back against the bench.

I want to stay with him but I decide against it.

“Yea you can bring me back to my car. I need to take a shower and get changed.”

I wait until he looks up but it takes a while and when he finally does, I hold my breath again without thinking. His eyes are light blue, the exact same shade than some pattern on his shirt, and they weirdly but beautifully glow.

“Are you gonna pick me up?”

I’m surprised that I didn’t even stutter and he quickly nods, grabbing his wallet from his pocket and pulling out a few bills, leaving them on the table.

“I can pay for my food, Harry, don’t worry.”

His eyes meet mine again and my words get stuck in my throat. He raises his eyebrows at me and shake his head slightly.

“No, It’s my pleasure, really.”

I want to argue again but instead, I send him a fond smile and mouth him a ‘thank you’. His lips quickly curl again and I lick my lips nervously. His gaze leaves mine and I breathe again as I watch him search his other pocket.

“Here, give me your number.” he says, handing me his phone. “I’ll text you and then you can give me your address.”

I take his phone but my heart seems to skip a beat when my fingers brush against his. This is ridiculous and I know it. Even if we were not total strangers, we barely knew each other now, and the fact that he had this effect on me was almost juvenile. Perhaps, it was just remnants of the friendship we used to have, but it was still driving me insane.

I quickly type my phone number and hand him back his phone, making sure we won’t touch this time. I follow him outside and he drives me back to my car in silence. I glance at him from time to time, enjoying the way he seems focused on the road while still taping the beat of the songs on the radio on the wheel.

I almost feel sad when I get out of his car to sit in mine and finally open my window as I start my car.

“My day would have been boring if I hadn’t met you, Styles!”

I see him smile and chuckle but he doesn’t answer and I finally just wave slightly at him as he does the same.
body_abstract: ABOUT THE STORY

I take his phone but my heart seems to skip a beat when my fingers brush against his. This is ridiculous and I know it. Even if we were not total strangers, we barely knew each other now, and the fact that he had this effect on me was almost juvenile. Perhaps, it was just remnants of the friendship we used to have, but it was still driving me insane.

I quickly type my phone number and hand him back his phone, making sure we won’t touch this time. I follow him outside and he drives me back to my car in silence. I glance at him from time to time, enjoying the way he seems focused on the road while still taping the beat of the songs on the radio on the wheel.

I almost feel sad when I get out of his car to sit in mine and finally open my window as I start my car.

“My day would have been boring if I hadn’t met you, Styles!”

I see him smile and chuckle but he doesn’t answer and I finally just wave slightly at him as he does the same.

“Do you want me to drop you back to your car?” I propose, trying to focus on my hands and avoiding her eyes for a reason I don’t understand. “I mean I thought about relaxing a bit before the party so I thought it wouldn’t be too interesting for you.”

OLIVIA

I felt an instant connection with him as soon as I saw him again but at this exact moment, while he’s sitting in front of me, staring at me, and making me a promise, I feel even closer to him. It’s hard to explain, it’s something that can’t be put into words. It’s something that you can only feel.

He thanks me for trusting him and I feel my heart skip a beat at the conversation we’re having. It seems so simple yet for some reason I feel like it’s deeper than it sounds.

He moves away and I realize I had been holding my breath. I inhaled deeply again but subtly and finally clear my throat, leaning back against the bench.

I want to stay with him but I decide against it.

“Yea you can bring me back to my car. I need to take a shower and get changed.”

I wait until he looks up but it takes a while and when he finally does, I hold my breath again without thinking. His eyes are light blue, the exact same shade than some pattern on his shirt, and they weirdly but beautifully glow.

“Are you gonna pick me up?”

I’m surprised that I didn’t even stutter and he quickly nods, grabbing his wallet from his pocket and pulling out a few bills, leaving them on the table.

“I can pay for my food, Harry, don’t worry.”

His eyes meet mine again and my words get stuck in my throat. He raises his eyebrows at me and shake his head slightly.

“No, It’s my pleasure, really.”

I want to argue again but instead, I send him a fond smile and mouth him a ‘thank you’. His lips quickly curl again and I lick my lips nervously. His gaze leaves mine and I breathe again as I watch him search his other pocket.

“Here, give me your number.” he says, handing me his phone. “I’ll text you and then you can give me your address.”

I take his phone but my heart seems to skip a beat when my fingers brush against his. This is ridiculous and I know it. Even if we were not total strangers, we barely knew each other now, and the fact that he had this effect on me was almost juvenile. Perhaps, it was just remnants of the friendship we used to have, but it was still driving me insane.

I quickly type my phone number and hand him back his phone, making sure we won’t touch this time. I follow him outside and he drives me back to my car in silence. I glance at him from time to time, enjoying the way he seems focused on the road while still taping the beat of the songs on the radio on the wheel.

I almost feel sad when I get out of his car to sit in mine and finally open my window as I start my car.

“My day would have been boring if I hadn’t met you, Styles!”

I see him smile and chuckle but he doesn’t answer and I finally just wave slightly at him as he does the same.

title: Call Girl
body:
We are strangers by day, lovers by night. Knowing it’s so wrong, feeling so right.

F O U R T E E N

When Ariana woke up, she wasn’t sure where she was or what happened. She didn’t even know what day it was. All she knew was she was lying in a hospital bed with wires and tubes connecting her to…
